gallery.noMatchHint: Try adjusting your search or filters

import.description: Select your Facebook or Messenger data export folders to get started. You can add multiple sources at once.

settings.title: Settings
settings.dataSourcesDesc: Manage imported Facebook and Messenger export folders
settings.removeSourceDesc: This will remove all imported data from this source. Your original export files will not be affected.
settings.dataStorageDesc: Manage your imported data and free up space
settings.clearAllDataDesc: This will permanently delete all imported conversations, media entries, and context messages from the database. Your original export files will not be affected. You can re-import them later.
settings.languageDesc: Choose the display language for the application

tutorial.title: How to Download Your Data
tutorial.openGuide: How do I get my data?
tutorial.intro: Follow the steps below for your platform to download your data export.
tutorial.fbStep1: Go to Facebook, click your profile picture in the top-right, then select "Settings & privacy" > "Settings".
tutorial.fbStep2: Click "See more in Accounts Center", then "Your information and permissions", and select "Export your information".
tutorial.msgStep1: Open Messenger, tap your profile picture, then go to "Privacy & Safety".
tutorial.msgStep2: Tap "End-to-end encrypted chats", then "Message storage", then "Download message storage data".
tutorial.msgStep3: When the file is ready, tap "Download file". Extract the ZIP and point this app at the extracted folder.
tutorial.step3: Tap "Download or transfer information". Select your account, then choose "Specific types of information" and pick "Messages" (or select all).
tutorial.step4: Select "Download to device". Set the format to JSON (important â€” not HTML), pick your preferred date range and media quality. Then tap "Create files".
tutorial.step5: You will be notified when your export is ready (can take minutes to hours). Download the ZIP file, extract it, then point this app at the extracted folder.
tutorial.tip: Tip: Choose JSON format, not HTML. This app requires the JSON format to parse your messages and media.
